SENT.plain: Persistent proatlantal artery type 1 is one of the four anastomotic vessels between the carotid and vertebrobasilar arterial systems
Persistence of this embryonic anastomosis is extremely rare

We present such a case with bilateral persistent proatlantal arteries that arose from internal carotid arteries, entered the skull via the foramen magnum and united with the horizontal portions of vertebral arteries
We also mention its embryology, potential clinical implications, and differentiating features between two types of proatlantal arteries
